Package soc.client

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ColorSquareListener
    Listen for changes to the value of the color square, when a user clicks or a setter is called.
    MainDisplay
    A facade for the SOCPlayerClient to use to invoke actions in the main GUI (as opposed to in-game PlayerClientListener): Connect, list games and chat channels, etc.
    PlayerClientListener
    A listener on the SOCPlayerClient to decouple the presentation from the networking.
    PlayerClientListener.NonBlockingDialogDismissListener
    Listener to be called when PlayerClientListener.isNonBlockingDialogVisible() becomes false.
    TradePanel.TPListener
    Listener for callback methods when TradePanel buttons are clicked.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AskDialog
    This is the generic modal dialog to ask players a two- or three-choice question; to present a one-button message, see NotifyDialog.
    AWTClickTester
    Standalone class to test for per-platform differences of click events and context-click (right-click).
    ChannelFrame
    The chat channel window
    ClientNetwork
    Helper object to encapsulate and deal with SOCPlayerClient's network connectivity.
    ColorSquare
    This is a square box with a background color and possibly a number, checkmark, or text in it.
    ColorSquareLarger
    This is a larger square box with a background color and possibly a number or X in it.
    FaceChooserFrame
    A popup dialog with all available SOCFaceButton icons for the user to browse and change to.
    FaceChooserFrame.FaceChooserList
    FaceChooserList holds face icons (in rows and columns) and an optional scrollbar.
    GameMessageSender
    Client class to form outgoing messages and call Connection methods to send them to the server.
    HelloWorldSwing  
    MessageHandler
    Nested class for processing incoming messages (treating).
    MessagePanel
    Panel to show a player's status text or response.
    NewGameOptionsFrame
    This is the dialog for a game's name and options to set, along with the client's user preferences such as SOCPlayerClient.PREF_SOUND_ON and per-game preferences such as SOCPlayerInterface.PREF_SOUND_MUTE.
    NotifyDialog
    This is a generic dialog to popup a message to the player, with one button.
    ServerGametypeInfo
    Track the server's information about the game type: valid game option set, scenarios, etc.
    ShadowedBox
    This is a shadowed box for use in the hand panel.
    SnippingTextArea
    A TextArea that limits lines displayed to MaximumLines on most platforms.
    SOCAccountClient
    Applet/Standalone client for connecting to the SOCServer and making user accounts.
    SOCBoardPanel
    This is a component that can display a Settlers of Catan Board.
    SOCBoardPanel.DelayedRepaint
    With a recent board resize, one or more rescaled images still hasn't been completed after 7 seconds.
    SOCBoardPanel.ResourceTradeAllMenu
    Menu for right-click on 3-for-1 port to trade all resource types with bank/port.
    SOCBuildingPanel
    This class is a panel that shows how much it costs to build things, and it allows the player to build.
    SOCChoosePlayerDialog
    This is the dialog to ask a player from whom she wants to steal.
    SOCConnectOrPracticePanel
    This is the dialog panel for standalone client startup (JAR or otherwise) if no command-line arguments.
    SOCConnectOrPracticePanel.BoxedJPanel
    JPanel for use in BoxLayout; overrides SOCConnectOrPracticePanel.BoxedJPanel.getMaximumSize() to prevent some unwanted extra width.
    SOCDialog
    Base modal dialog class to consistently handle basic Swing setup.
    SOCDiscardOrGainResDialog
    This is the dialog to ask players what resources they want to discard from rolling a 7, or to gain from the gold hex.
    SOCFaceButton
    This is a component that can display a face.
    SOCFaceButton.FaceButtonPopupMenu
    Menu for right-click on face icon to choose a new face (Player's hand only).
    SOCHandPanel
    This panel displays a player's information.
    SOCHandPanel.ResourceTradeMenuItem
    Menu item for right-click on resource square to trade with bank/port.
    SOCHandPanel.ResourceTradePopupMenu
    Menu for right-click on resource square to trade with bank/port.
    SOCHandPanel.ResourceTradeTypeMenu
    Menu for right-click on resource square to trade one resource type with bank/port.
    SOCMonopolyDialog
    Dialog to prompt player to pick a resource to monopolize, with buttons for the 5 resource types.
    SOCPlayerClient
    Standalone client for connecting to the SOCServer.
    SOCPlayerInterface
    Window with interface for a player in one game of Settlers of Catan.
    SOCPlayerInterface.ClientBridge
    Client Bridge to translate PCL interface to SOCPlayerInterface methods.
    SOCPlayerInterface.ResetBoardConfirmDialog
    This is the modal dialog to confirm resetting the board after a practice game.
    SOCPlayerInterface.ResetBoardVoteDialog
    This is the modal dialog to vote on another player's board reset request.
    SOCPracticeAskDialog
    Dialog to ask players if they want to join an existing practice game or start a new one.
    SOCQuitAllConfirmDialog
    This is the dialog to confirm when someone closes the client.
    SOCQuitConfirmDialog
    Modal dialog to confirm when someone clicks the Quit Game button or the game window's close button.
    SOCSpecialItemDialog
    This is a modal dialog for info / actions related to known SOCSpecialItems.
    Sounds
    Utility class for creating and playing basic synthesized sounds with the javax.sound.sampled package.
    SpeechBalloon
    This is a rectangular speech balloon shape for use in the hand panel.
    SquaresPanel
    Display grid of give/get resources for trade and bank/port offers. 2 rows of 5 columns of ColorSquareLarger: 1 column per resource type: Clay, ore, sheep, wheat, wood.
    SwingMainDisplay
    A MainDisplay implementation for Swing.
    TradePanel
    Panel for a trade offer or counter-offer in a non-client player's SOCHandPanel.
    UserPreferences
    Gathered static methods to use persistent user preferences if available, or defaults if not.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    PlayerClientListener.UpdateType
    Player data update types for PlayerClientListener.playerElementUpdated(SOCPlayer, PlayerClientListener.UpdateType, boolean, boolean)
